intro: Aulomyrcia pallens var. ovalis, commonly known as the oval-leafed alpine shrub, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are oval in shape, leathery, and arranged in whorls around the stems, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aulomyrcia pallens var. ovalis thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments.
